p: Transmission patterns between different risk groups show the disproportionate epidemiologic role of smaller populations of people living with HIV with unmet treatment needs. In the context of marginalization of key populations enforced by stigmatizing laws (Same Sex Marriage Prohibition Act 2013), these findings provide a public health rationale for governments and health leaders to address the needs of key populations with comprehensive preventative services. Structured coalescent analyses indicates that a substantial proportion of HIV infections in the general female population are linked epidemiologically to the MSM to female bridge which is consistent with reported sexual behaviors and observed incidence trends.
